title: Stayed at Amara
desc: I stayed at the Amara during my vacation in Singapore. I booked a deluxe king room which was overall very nice. The only problem was I had a conjoining room and could hear everything the room next to me was doing including coughing all night and watching tv. I asked to change rooms and the staff was very accommodating and upgraded my room to a higher class room. The pool was also under renovation at the time, but one completed I‚Äôm sure it will be nice!!

title: Nice and fantastic place
desc: It is nice and fantastic chill out place for foods and drinks with friends and colleagues.. there are variety of foods and wines to choose. Price is reasonable with good atmosphere to stay after works. It definitely a place to be visit regularly.

title: Banking Conference & Awards Gala at The AMARA Singapore
desc: Fantastic service and a great venue to run an intimate business conference. Utmost professionalism by Jeffrey who was our event manager for the day and went above and beyond what was required. Thanks to Jeffrey, the experience we had was brilliant and unrivalled. Highly recommend this venue but be sure to ask for JEFFREY!

title: Excellent Customer Service
desc: Can not say enough good things about Aqilah the front clerk who helped us there was some confusion with our booking but she was so gracious and helpful and did everything possible to insure we were comfortable and taken care of the best part of this hotel is the staff everone we encounter was exceptional from the maid to the bell staff great job Amara Singapore you set the bar high when it comes to guests satisfaction I will be back.

title: Another great stay
desc: Just completing our one week stay at the Amara Hotel and as always, it has been a great stay. Comfortable room, good buffet breakfast, excellent restaurants. Very good location, MRT a block away, short walk to Chinatown, good for taxis too. Swimming pool and gym, and long walks in Botanic Gardens and East Coast kept us healthy! Our breakfast experience enhanced by excellent service daily from Wan Ting who looked after us so well. Sad to say she is leaving the hotel for a job nearer her home. We will definitely be back here again.

title: Excellent Service!
desc: We hold our monthly auctions at Level 3 Connection Room 1. Jeffrey is always so friendly and obliging. The best thing is, he knows what we need and want and delivers them. Awesome place to hold your meetings and events.

title: Hotel with a lot of potential
desc: PROS: Great location if you want to explore both Chinatown and the smaller more quaint streets of Singapore. Also the staff are very friendly and engaging. Lastly, the hotel I see in walking distance of a number of banks, money exchange bureaus, mini-marts, supermarkets as well as the public transportation. CONS: The hotel rooms are a bit dated and the price for the rooms especially including club lounge access are not necessarily value for money when I compare it when staying at other hotels with the same price point. TIPS: We booked a family suite and it came with a handset that allowed us to access Google Maps as well as make local and regional calls during the stay complimentary ( we were told this was a common feature in many mid to high end hotels in Singapore.

title: Comfortable end to our holiday
desc: Our family enjoyed a very comfortable stay at Amara, at the end of our holiday. Nice rooms, good location (close access to metro, Chinatown, Sentosa), lots of restaurants nearby. Raymond the concierge was a highlight, with good ideas for excursions and plenty of smiles and lovely chats with our kids. I would recommend a stay here.

title: An average 5 star hotel
desc: The customer service was good. The aircon in the room was not cool enough and when informed front desk, they said thermostat is spoilt. Bathtub had blood stains and wasnt maintained well enough. The room service ordered was delayed and food arrived nearly a hour after ordering.

title: Excellent 5 star hotel in a good location near businesses
desc: I booked this hotel for the first time on my recent trip to Singapore as I got an excellent deal in Agoda.com. Since my flight reached at 10 am I reached the hotel by 10.45 and they were nice to give me early checkin by 11 itself. The room is fairly spacious with the double bed and a working desk close to the window. The bathroom is large and has a bathtub apart from a shower room. The shower is a bit old and water dispensation is not great but manageable. The amenities kept are good. The clothes cupboard is also good with old type glass doors similar to the bathrooms. The entire room is nicely carpeted so need the slippers for washroom only. The location of the hotel is very good next to Carlton and Oasia and 5 minutes walking distance fron Tanjong Pagar A entrance. The

title: Staycation on 12 Jan 19
desc: Attended a friend's wedding that day and decided to stay for a night after the wedding event due to some unfortunate incident after the wedding.. Wedding banquet was okay (nothing to compliment or complain) but the room was great! Spacious, nice bed, comfortable bathroom size with all amenities required! I would like to commend Raymond from Concierge on his extra-mile service in assisting my boyfriend and I during our stay, gave courtesy call before his working hours to ensure the well-being of us! Raymond indeed has surpassed our expectation especially we both are in the service industry. Good job Raymond!

title: Wonderful stay
desc: This hotel is lovely. Big airy rooms, staff that can't do enough for you, enormous comfy beds. The swimming pool was great even though a bit of a treck to get there as there are building works. Breakfast was amazing , all you could ever want.

title: Christmas Get-away
desc: The staff, in particular the concierge staff, were lovely and the food at the restaurants within the hotel were very nice. The beds are terribly uncomfortable- it was like sleeping on a rock literally. And the pillows don‚Äôt hold their form. I‚Äôd say they need a serious revamp in this department as based on the discomfort from the sleep experience alone I wouldn‚Äôt stay again. The bathroom needed a serious scrubbing although to be perfectly honest, I think the tiles need to be ripped out and new tiles relayed. It just wasn‚Äôt crisp and clean enough for me. The location is ideal if you want to be in the City on business but for us that wasn‚Äôt a concern if anything We found ourselves a little bit too far from all the must be places. Their pool area isn‚Äôt great. They don‚Äôt have

title: I love Amara and Singaporeans
desc: Great team works in this hotel. Just one example: when we were leaving hotel for airport very early in the morning, three people from personnel tried to assist in catching a taxi on the street and by the phone. Other good things: club room, plentiful breakfasts , nice swimming pool for exercise and location of cause!

title: Disappointed
desc: Spent two nights at this Hotel whilst visiting Singapore. Chose Hotel manly because of Pool and Gym only to discover they were undergoing refurbishment, although this was not advised when booking. The pool is accessible but the Gym is closed completely! Not even an apology from staff. The Hotel is well located but room rather tired and staff not particularly friendly or helpful. Plenty of other Hotels around so would not use this one again. Didn‚Äôt eat at the Hotel so unable to comment on the food.

title: Great Location ,
desc: Many restaurants in the area. Breakfast could have been better. Still more Chinese/SEA type breakfast. Location perfect for families. Was a good place to walk around.Facilities at Hotel Ok. Just stayed overnight two times

title: The customer service is really bad
desc: How come such a big hotel during peak hour like 2 pm there is only one staff at the receptionist and it tooks ages for the queue to move ? The worst is thing is the staff is so rude and impolite. The check in time is 2 o clock and I wait more than half an hour not even check in yet. Quite disappointing.

title: Raymond the concierge is great
desc: The Amara has a great location and a nice Thai restaurant but the real reason to return is that Raymond at the Concierge desk is a true gentleman and takes great care of every guest. I had already checked out, was late to the airport and in the wrong clothes and Raymond found me a very clean and comfortable place to change.

title: Club Room with Club Benefits
desc: Club Room were on the higher floors however, surrounding areas were mostly HDB flats which doesn't provide much of a view. Hotel is within 10min walk from Tanjong Pagar MRT Station and situated right next to 100AM Mall (with Don Son Donki that opens till 12am). Food are easily accessible from the hawker centre/market opposite or Korean Restaurants down the road which operates till late! Otherwise there are supermarkets situated nearby for late night shopping. Room was great with really comfortable beds and club room came with bath tub and toiletries. Club room benefits offered lounge access for Breakfast (Wide array of food), High Tea (Comes in a set with free flow drinks from Club Soda to TWG Teas) and Dinner (which we missed unfortunately)! At $200+ per night, it was a

title: It's Never A Yes - But Keep Asking
desc: Whenever I visit Singapore, I usually stay in this part of town because it's convenient and close to my office. Amara Singapore is the last of hotels I've stayed in the area and compared to its neighboring hotels, and I'd probably say this is the worst one of the bunch. The only redeeming quality of the hotel is the probably the breakfast buffet selection. I stayed here for 4 nights and upon check-in at 8pm on a Sunday, I was told that only a room with two twin size beds was available and was subsequently asked if that was OK (um, of course not)!. I pushed and said that I made my booking weeks ago and that I'm staying here for 4 nights, so they're going to have to do better than that. A few minutes later, they came back and said that they sorted something out. Um, perhaps they

title: Very hospitable
desc: We stayed at Amara for my Mum's 60th birthday recently. We were always greeted with smiles from all of the staff and they were always very helpful in ensuring we had a great time whilst in Singapore. The location was perfect for getting around easily to attractions, and was conveniently very close to some local hawkers markets. China Town is within walking distance too. The rooms were all very clean and the room service was prompt and efficient.

title: Amara hotel in Singapore
desc: It is really good place to stay near chinatown and service also good as well. Just 10min from chinatown. Room is big enough. You also can use laundry service by yourself at 8floor and you need to change coin at reception. Washing 10. Dry 10. Total need 20

title: No smile staff
desc: Stay at club lounge during cny with family, when having evening cocktail a girl (unknown her name)work at club lounge is no smile at all, should watch own manner when work at 5star hotel. Room and location is ok.

title: Wonderful Hotel in the perfect location
desc: The Amara Hotel is the grand dame of Tanjong Pagar. Located in one of the great food centers of Singapore you will find a great range of food options including the famous Maxwell Market Hawker Center as well as lots of Japanese and Korean options as well as one of the best Peranakan restaurants, Blue Ginger. The hotel is conveniently located within an easy walk to Singapore's China Town as well as its central Business District. It's a quick walk to the subway or MRT which connects you easily and quickly to the rest of Singapore. The hotel it self is the oldest in the area which now several options but still is the best in the area. The rooms have been renovated recently and are good sized and functional for business travel with all you need to work and relax. The

title: Best Location
desc: One of the best hotels and friendly staff , Gihan the gentleman and the breakfast buffet is one of the best waiters I‚Äôve had experienced Keep up the good work The mall next door houses a super market in its basement which has good food and snacks for anyone Starbucks is also a plus point

title: Great location in Chinatown.
desc: I took my partner to Singapore for a special treat and we stayed at the AMARA where I had stayed several times before. The room as usual was very comfortable with an excellent bathroom and nice rain shower. We tried several restaurants in the near vicinity and there was both MRT behind the hotel and buses to Clark Quay opposite. Special thanks must go to Raymond the Concierge who was always smiling and a great source of information about places to visit and how to get there. I look forward to my next stay.

title: Nice place
desc: The hotel was nice and quiet place. The beds are comfortable and the room was clean. Breakfests were tasty and club room was good place to stay at evening. It is close to China town and other places are close too.

title: Excellent work and effort from staff of Amara hotel Singapore
desc: Have book a staycation with Amara Hotel Singapore this weekend to celebrate my Son 100th Days celebration. Extremely friendly staff from Concierge, helping to through the reservation And as well as the event for the actual celebration. A special surprise for me as we enter the room. A Special thanks to housekeeping and concierge for the wonderfully set up room. My family love it. Not forgetting Esther from reservation for all the arrangements. And last but not least, a special thanks to Raymond from concierge, going the extra mile to help me through my rooms reservations and also my Son 100th days celebration buffet. Staying back after his working hours just to make sure I am well taken care off. Overall well done to the team of Amara Singapore.

title: Great Service of Amara Hotel
desc: Five Star Service staff at Amara Hotel. Location convenient. Shop and done at 100AM Mall beside the hotel. Nice snacks available free of charge at front desk. Travel conveniently by MRT @ Tanjong Pagar MRT.

title: Pleasant Stay
desc: This hotel is not a place that is easily be found. The room is big and clean. Quite disappointed about their swimming pool, it's inconvenient due to renovation. Not being told in advance that this hotel is undergoing renovation, some of the facilities are unable to use, but the gym is good! Overall is a pleasant stay.

title: Accommodating Team
desc: Great place and most specially great service from Jenny M! Please look for her in Amara Singapore. Thanks so much! All frontliners are nice :-) They give good advice on directions and where to go. Would love to return!!

title: Lovely stay in club room
desc: Had an excellent 4 night stay on the club floor in this comfortable hotel. All staff were very friendly and helpful especially those in the club lounge. Their conduct over a wallet left in the lounge by mistake was exemplary. Complimentary evening snacks were tasty and nicely presented and the breakfast offered more than adequate. Room was spacious and comfortable with excellent helpful maid and free laundry service. A most pleasant stay.

title: Would defo stay again!
desc: This is a decent hotel with a couple great points: 1) The service is excellent. The concierge desk is very helpful, especially Raymond Foo who gave us great advice on where to eat crab nearby (Melben). He even helped get us a reservation when I'd called myself and was told that the restaurants had no bookings left. He goes above and beyond to help! 2) The location. Right across the street there's a vendor market with great local foods. A 5 minute walk away, there's another plaza (Maxwell House) with awesome eats. And maybe a 10 minute walk away there's Chinatown. Very close to the tram/subway station too. Good place to get Grabs (their Uber) as well. The hotel is also connected to the 100 am shopping plaza, where there's a Starbucks, Subway, awesome chinese bakeries, a

title: Great Service
desc: I've stayed here 3 times over the last year. Rooms are comfy, food is great, very handy to shops and markets. Breakfast is busy but comprehensive: there is everything. I think it's the most comprehensive breakfast I've seen. Staff are what makes a hotel successful. Staff here are excellent. Standout is Raymond at Concierge. Thanks for a great stay, looking forward to my next stay!

title: Good Service
desc: Was at Element for a after work drink on a Friday night. The service staff were excellent despite the hectic night. Special compliments to Mary Liu for her wonderful service with a smile.Thanks. Will come again.

title: Mr. Raymond Foo!
desc: Our group of 33 ppl stayed at this hotel from Jan. 3rd - 7th. We love the hotel's location and its cleanliness. However, the person that we are really impressed with and the reason for this review was Mr. Raymond Foo. From the minutes that we stepped into the hotel,he was very helpful, funny and helpful in so many ways. He gave us a list of best places to eat with reasonable price within walking distance. When we went on tours the next day, he lent us some hats and gave everyone water bottles and some peanuts. Highly recommended this hotel and do ask for Mr. Raymond Foo if you have any questions or need any help.

title: Event at Amara Hotel Singapore
desc: We had our company Chinese New Year Dinner and Dance at Amara Hotel on 19.01.19. The service was impeccable and food was delicious. Our Banquet Manager for that evening is Mr Jeffrey Goh. He is attentive to every single detail of our dinner and made sure that the everything runs smoothly.

title: Great stay amazing staff-Amara!
desc: Had an amazing experience at Amara Singapore. Warm, jovial and extremely helpful staff.Shall strongly recommend this for a stay! For expert advice - be it food, shopping or sightseeing please ask for Mr. Raymond- he is a true help

title: Nice hotel
desc: Good hotel near China town, Raymond the concierge was great when we came back from a day out to collect our luggage to go to airport. Although the we had checked out in the morning he supplied us with lots of water and snacks while we were waiting around before travelling to airport.

title: Really enjoyable stay!!
desc: My husband and I were fortunate to stay in a Club room for 7 nights, Definitely worth staying in these rooms if you can. We certainly made use of the Club lounge for cocktail/canapes hours and sometimes afternoon tea hours if we were in. The staff working on the 17th floor are very friendly and attentive. Breakfast in the Club lounge was nice for the quiet although we had breakfast at Element on most days because of the variety of food available. We used the complimentary laundry service (two items a day) and our clothes were well taken care of. So handy given the humidity. Concierge and front reception staff were also very friendly and helpful. Special shout out to Raymond, who was entertaining and great to talk to, and he helped my family get a reservation for a

title: Nice Hotel
desc: I stayed at Amara Hotel Singapore for a change after trying various others in the area of Tanjong Pagar. The stay was pleasant but I would like to highlight some areas that can be improved. 1. The cleanliness items in the room, especially the sofa in the room is unacceptable, it was soiled and dirty. 2. The minibar items were not replenished even after repeated requests. 3. Front desk personnels should be trained to smile.

title: Club room !!!
desc: We stayed 5 nights during Christmas in a club room, well worth it with breakfast in the morning in a quiet environnement, and free drinks and littles bits during happy hour. The room was spacious and clean with a great shower. Location is very good 5 min from the subway and 10 minutes from Chinatown

title: Great hotel stay
desc: Loved our stay at the Amara. The staff were amongst the most helpful ever encountered. Nothing was too much trouble. Raymond is an absolute star at the concierge desk. The hotel is in a brilliant location for getting around, close to Raffles Place and Chinatown by MRT from Tangan Pagar station.

title: Fabulous Staff at a great hotel
desc: Firstly, I would like to start off by saying I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone considering it. I don't normally write reviews of hotels, but because of the amazing service we received from staff, in particular Ragu, I felt compelled to write one. We recently stayed at Amara, over New year's. The hotel itself is beautiful and very clean and in a great location. However, it is the staff who make this hotel what it is. Upon arrival, we experienced a few problems with check in, which were not down to the hotel, but actually our travel agents fault. Ragu, the reservations manager, acted very quickly and smartly and resolved the issue above and beyond what we had expected. I cannot thank him enough for what he did. He went out of his way to make sure we were happy.

title: Great hotel in Chinatown
desc: My husband and I had a one night stay before we went on our cruise. I was very pleased with the hotel and I got a great deal for their Club Room which offered just enough food and plenty of drink. The buffet breakfast was fantastic as well. Special mention to Raymond the concierge who was very helpful as well as humorous.

title: Always Something New
desc: This is my 1st stay in Amara for 2019 but my nth stay in the hotel. Check-in always convenient and pleasant. The familiarity may not be with the faces of the people at the check in counter or reception but the attitude is always welcoming and helpful. This time around, I stayed for 4 nights and always looked forward to having their buffet breakfast. The food selection is just enough, not too few and the staff, very efficient and most of all courteous. On my 2nd to the last day, I accidentally left my room key/card and Raymond Foo, who was at the concierge, readily assisted to have it replaced. It didnt take him 5 mins to do that! During my Oct 2018 trip, I had a sprained knee and every night I had requested thru the concierge for a bucket of ice which was provided

title: Fantastic Service and Hospitality
desc: Amara is always my first choice when I need a accommodation/food, only because of the exceptional service level provided by the staff, like Raymond Foo. Please keep up the good work Amara! Always feels like home when Raymond is around!

title: Raymond Foo is the best!
desc: We had a 2 night stay at Amara before transferring to Marina Bat Sands. The stay was beautiful, they service was amazing and the buffet breakfast was incredible. After the stay I realised I left my backpack in the room and it was an easy fix when I went to go pick it up with the help of concierge Raymond Foo. He was welcoming and helpful, treating me to free water and enjoyable conversation while I waited for my backpack. Highly recommend this place!

title: Wedding at Amara at 12 Jan 2019
desc: Host my wedding at Amara hotel with fantastic support from all the staff. Everything request was dealt with perfection and all guests were in awe with the services standard by Amara. Special thanks to Ivan,Jeffrey, Alan and Reegall for attending to all our requirements and always being patience with us. Will highly recommend everyone to consider hosting their weddding banquet at Amara Singapoe.

title: Best concierge
desc: Travelling with family in a group of six and with kids. Get around in Singapore taxi is definitely working the best for us. But who knows there are so many different types of taxi and all different types of surcharges that we are not aware of. Thanks for Raymond Foo who works at the concierge at Amara who gave the best advice ever! On our first day out as usual I approached the concierge and after a maxi taxi. They could have just help me to booked one. But instead Raymond asked me where are you guys going?! And he worked it out for me will be better off if we splits in two taxi because of the $10 booking fee for maxi and $3 per head city surcharge. The total fare of the trip is only $6 sth x 2 taxi are still cheaper than a maxi. On our way back to the airport he helps us

title: Great centrally located hotel with excellent service
desc: I have been coming and staying at this hotel for a weekly holiday for over 5 years in a row, and I thought it best to finally give the hotel a review. My 9 year old son absolutely loves coming to Singapore as he loves the staff, especially Raymond as he is very kind and helpful. My elderly Mum also enjoys staying at this hotel as it‚Äôs very close to 2 great Chinese grocery stores, a Japanese grocery store as well as a Daiso. She also likes the fact that there is an air conditioned food court within the 100am complex next door. We love having interconnected rooms and the rooms are quite large for Singapore. Overall, we are very happy and love coming here in January. Here‚Äôs a pic of my son giving Chinese New Year gift to Raymond for looking after us this week.

title: Stay at amara hotel
desc: The employees are very helpfull and polite. We had a blast! Douze points goes to the amara hotel! üéâüôèüèª The rooms are clean, the swimmingpool very relaxing and the conci√´rge was a funny guy. Love this place

title: Deb and Heather and the Thunderbirds
desc: We came all the way from Australia and Malaysia to join Deb and sister Heather and 7 friends from NZ Australia UK and US to celebrate a birthday. The Amara and Raymond Foo the manager made us feel like the most important people in the world. It has been an amazing experience celebrating at this hotel. The staff are wonderful.

title: Amazing staff makes this hotel 5 stars
desc: The Amara is in a good location for the Metro and local shopping and the rooms are a good size. We had a Club Room and the extra cost for the upgrade paid for itself in providing access to a great breakfast, afternoon tea and free drinks/cocktails for 2 hours with canapes. All the above was wonderful and great value but the care and attention we received from the staff was second to none. Each and every one we encountered from Check In to the management, the waiting staff at Club Level and the security staff were superb. The Management can be really proud of their people and the professionalism they bring to the guest experience.

title: A great hotel near Chinatown
desc: We stayed at the Hotel Amara for one week to have some time to explore Singapore before the cruise. A beautiful hotel with great restaurants and the hotel buffet breakfast was excellent, a huge selection of food and everything was delicious. Also things that impressed us were the staff- they are so friendly, especially the concierge desk, they provided us a lot of useful tips and information to get around Singapore. We would like to thank Ms. Shang Yingzi and her team, they are very good at their jobs and made us want to come back if we visit Singapore again. Thanks for an amazing stay.

title: Great Service and value
desc: Clean rooms, great service and great amenities. Special shout out to Raymond on front office desk who provided us with plenty of laughs! Would thoroughly recommend to anyone staying in Singapore! See you guys soon.

title: Staying at Amara Singapore
desc: Oonah at the reception was very helpful, all staff very friendly, hotel a bit old, but room clean, nice location in Singapore, very convenient to major ateas in the city. Small shopping centre nearby, with many Japanese brands.

title: Memorable experience
desc: Thank you for the great hospitality. Front office team the reception ‚ù§Ô∏èJohn , was attentive and professional in serving me . I booked a twin room but i didn‚Äôt want to sleep with 2 beds . He assisted me to do a room change to king bed room . Thanks for the help sir . My stay was great.
